verses.verse: And Jacob<WH3290> dwelt<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of his father<WH1>'s sojournings<WH4033>, in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>.

These are the generations<WH8435> of Jacob<WH3290>. Joseph<WH3130>, being seventeen<WH6240> years<WH8141> old<WH1121>, was feeding<WH7462> the flock<WH6629> with his brethren<WH251>; and he was a lad<WH5288> with the sons<WH1121> of Bilhah<WH1090>, and with the sons<WH1121> of Zilpah<WH2153>, his father<WH1>'s wives<WH802>: and Joseph<WH3130> brought<WH935> the evil<WH7451> report<WH1681> of them unto their father<WH1>.

Now Israel<WH3478> loved<WH157> Joseph<WH3130> more than all his children<WH1121>, because he was the son<WH1121> of his old age<WH2208>: and he made<WH6213> him a coat<WH3801> of many colors<WH6446>.

And his brethren<WH251> saw<WH7200> that their father<WH1> loved<WH157> him more than all his brethren<WH251>; and they hated<WH8130> him<WH3201>, and could not speak<WH1696> peaceably unto him<WH7965>.
And Joseph<WH3130> dreamed<WH2492> a dream<WH2472>, and he told<WH5046> it to his brethren<WH251>: and they hated<WH8130> him yet the more<WH3254>.
And he said<WH559> unto them<WH8085>, Hear, I pray you<WH2472>, this dream which I have dreamed<WH2492>:

for <WH481>, behold, we were binding sheaves<WH485> in the field<WH7704>, and<WH485>, lo, my sheaf arose<WH6965>, and also stood upright<WH5324>; and<WH485>, behold, your sheaves came round about<WH5437>, and made obeisance<WH7812> to my sheaf<WH485>.

And his brethren<WH251> said<WH559> to him<WH4427>, Shalt thou indeed reign<WH4427> over us<WH4910>? or shalt thou indeed have dominion<WH4910> over us<WH8130>? And they hated him yet the more<WH3254> for his dreams<WH2472>, and for his words<WH1697>.

And he dreamed<WH2492> yet another<WH312> dream<WH2472>, and told<WH5608> it to his brethren<WH251>, and said<WH559>, Behold<WH2492>, I have dreamed yet a dream<WH2472>: and<WH8121>, behold, the sun and the moon<WH3394> and eleven<WH6240> stars<WH3556> made obeisance to me<WH7812>.

And he told<WH5608> it to his father<WH1>, and to his brethren<WH251>; and his father<WH1> rebuked<WH1605> him<WH559>, and said unto him<WH2472>, What is this dream that thou hast dreamed<WH2492>? Shall I and thy mother<WH517> and thy brethren<WH251> indeed<WH935> come<WH935> to bow down<WH7812> ourselves to thee to the earth<WH776>?
And his brethren<WH251> envied<WH7065> him<WH1>; but his father kept<WH8104> the saying in mind<WH1697>.
And his brethren<WH251> went<WH3212> to feed<WH7462> their father<WH1>'s flock<WH6629> in Shechem<WH7927>.

And Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> unto Joseph<WH3130>, Are not thy brethren<WH251> feeding<WH7462> the flock in Shechem<WH7927>? come<WH3212>, and I will send thee<WH7971> unto them<WH559>. And he said to him, Here am I.

And he said<WH559> to him<WH3212>, Go now<WH7200>, see whether it is well<WH7965> with thy brethren<WH251>, and well<WH7965> with the flock<WH6629>; and bring<WH7725> me word<WH1697> again<WH7725>. So he sent<WH7971> him out of the vale<WH6010> of Hebron<WH2275>, and he came<WH935> to Shechem<WH7927>.
And a certain man<WH376> found him<WH4672>, and<WH8582>, behold, he was wandering in the field<WH7704>: and the man<WH376> asked him<WH7592>, saying<WH559>, What seekest thou<WH1245>?
And he said<WH559>, I am seeking<WH1245> my brethren<WH251>: tell<WH5046> me<WH375>, I pray thee, where they are feeding the flock<WH7462>.

And the man<WH376> said<WH559>, They are departed<WH5265> hence<WH2088>; for I heard<WH8085> them say<WH559>, Let us go<WH3212> to Dothan<WH1886>. And Joseph<WH3130> went<WH3212> after<WH310> his brethren<WH251>, and found<WH4672> them in Dothan<WH1886>.
And they saw<WH7200> him afar off<WH7350>, and before he came near<WH7126> unto them<WH5230>, they conspired against him to slay him<WH4191>.
And they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH251>, Behold<WH1976>, this dreamer<WH1167> cometh<WH935>.

Come <WH3212> now therefore<WH2026>, and let us slay him<WH7993>, and cast him into one<WH259> of the pits<WH953>, and we will say<WH559>, An evil<WH7451> beast<WH2416> hath devoured<WH398> him<WH7200>: and we shall see what will become of his dreams<WH2472>.
And Reuben<WH7205> heard<WH8085> it<WH5337>, and delivered him out of their hand<WH3027>, and said<WH559>, Let us not take his life<WH5221>.

And Reuben<WH7205> said<WH559> unto them<WH8210>, Shed no blood<WH1818>; cast<WH7993> him into this pit<WH953> that is in the wilderness<WH4057>, but lay<WH7971> no hand<WH3027> upon him<WH5337>: that he might deliver him out of their hand<WH3027>, to restore<WH7725> him to his father<WH1>.

And it came to pass<WH3130>, when Joseph was come<WH935> unto his brethren<WH251>, that they stripped Joseph<WH3130> of<WH854> his coat<WH3801>, the coat<WH3801> of<WH854> many colors that was on him<WH6446>;
and they took<WH3947> him<WH7993>, and cast him into the pit<WH953>: and the pit<WH953> was empty<WH7386>, there was no water in it<WH4325>.

And they sat down<WH3427> to eat<WH398> bread<WH3899>: and they lifted up<WH5375> their eyes<WH5869> and looked<WH7200>, and<WH736>, behold, a caravan of Ishmaelites<WH3459> was coming<WH935> from Gilead<WH1568>, with their camels<WH1581> bearing<WH5375> spicery<WH5219> and balm<WH6875> and myrrh<WH3910>, going<WH1980> to carry it down<WH3381> to Egypt<WH4714>.
And Judah<WH3063> said<WH559> unto his brethren<WH251>, What profit<WH1215> is it if we slay<WH2026> our brother<WH251> and conceal<WH3680> his blood<WH1818>?

Come <WH3212>, and let us sell<WH4376> him to the Ishmaelites<WH3459>, and let not our hand<WH3027> be upon him<WH251>; for he is our brother, our flesh<WH1320>. And his brethren<WH251> hearkened unto him<WH8085>.

And there passed<WH5674> by Midianites<WH4084>, merchantmen<WH582>; and they drew<WH4900> and lifted up<WH5927> Joseph<WH3130> out of the pit<WH953>, and sold<WH4376> Joseph<WH3130> to the Ishmaelites<WH3459> for twenty<WH6242> pieces of silver<WH3701>. And they brought<WH935> Joseph<WH3130> into Egypt<WH4714>.
And Reuben<WH7205> returned<WH7725> unto the pit<WH953>; and<WH3130>, behold, Joseph was not in the pit<WH953>; and he rent<WH7167> his clothes<WH899>.
And he returned<WH7725> unto his brethren<WH251>, and said<WH559>, The child<WH3206> is not<WH575>; and I, whither shall I go<WH935>?
And they took<WH3947> Joseph<WH3130>'s coat<WH3801>, and killed<WH7819> a<WH8163> he-goat<WH5795>, and dipped<WH2881> the coat<WH3801> in the blood<WH1818>;

and they sent<WH7971> the coat<WH3801> of many colors<WH6446>, and they brought<WH935> it to their father<WH1>, and said<WH559>, This have we found<WH4672>: know<WH5234> now whether it is thy son<WH1121>'s coat or not<WH3801>.
And he knew it<WH5234>, and said<WH559>, It is my son<WH1121>'s coat<WH3801>; an evil<WH7451> beast<WH2416> hath devoured<WH398> him<WH3130>; Joseph is without doubt<WH2963> torn in pieces<WH2963>.
And Jacob<WH3290> rent<WH7167> his garments<WH8071>, and put<WH7760> sackcloth<WH8242> upon his loins<WH4975>, and mourned<WH56> for his son<WH1121> many<WH7227> days<WH3117>.

And all his sons<WH1121> and all his daughters<WH1323> rose up<WH6965> to comfort<WH5162> him<WH3985>; but he refused to be comforted<WH5162>; and he said<WH559>, For I will go down<WH3381> to Sheol<WH7585> to my son<WH1121> mourning<WH57>. And his father<WH1> wept for him<WH1058>.
And the Midianites<WH4092> sold<WH4376> him into Egypt<WH4714> unto Potiphar<WH6318>, an officer<WH5631> of Pharaoh<WH6547>'s, the captain<WH8269> of the guard<WH2876>.
